intro: Trichopteryx togoensis, commonly known as the Togo sandmat, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Trichopteryx togoensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
